org.mockito
Interface Strictly

public interface Strictly

Allows strict order verification. E.g: 

 Strictly strictly = strictly(firstMock, secondMock);
 
 strictly.verify(firstMock).add("should be called first");
 strictly.verify(secondMock).add("should be called second");
See examples Mockito.strictly(Object...)

Method Summary
<T> T
verify(T mock)
          Verifies mock object strictly in order.
<T> T
verify(T mock, VerificationMode mode)
          Verifies mock object strictly in order.
 

Method Detail

verify

<T> T verify(T mock)
Verifies mock object strictly in order. E.g: 
 Strictly strictly = strictly(firstMock, secondMock);
 
 strictly.verify(firstMock).someMethod("should be called first");
 strictly.verify(secondMock).someMethod("should be called second");

See examples Mockito

Parameters:
mock - to be verified
Returns:
mock object itself

verify

<T> T verify(T mock,
             VerificationMode mode)
Verifies mock object strictly in order. E.g: 
 Strictly strictly = strictly(firstMock, secondMock);
 
 strictly.verify(firstMock, times(2)).someMethod("should be called first two times");
 strictly.verify(secondMock, atLeastOnce()).someMethod("should be called second");

See examples Mockito

Parameters:
mock - to be verified
mode - times(x) or atLeastOnce()
Returns:
mock object itself
